Add `tmux` installation and configuration to the setup.

1.  **Check for existing config**: Look in `assets/` for any existing `.tmux.conf` or similar.
2.  **Create Config**: If none exists, create a sensible default `tmux.conf` in `assets/` that integrates well with the terminal (e.g., mouse support, true color, status bar).
3.  **Update Script**: Modify `scripts/core_setup.sh` (or create `scripts/tmux_setup.sh` if you prefer, but core seems fine) to:
    *   Install `tmux` via package manager.
    *   Symlink or copy the `tmux.conf` to the user's home directory (or `~/.config/tmux/`).
4.  **Verify**: Ensure the script runs without errors.

+# =============================================================================
+# tmux Configuration
+# =============================================================================
+
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# General Settings
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+# Enable true color support
+set -g default-terminal "tmux-256color"
+set -ga terminal-overrides ",*256col*:Tc"
+
+# Enable mouse support
+set -g mouse on
+
+# Start windows and panes at 1, not 0
+set -g base-index 1
+setw -g pane-base-index 1
+
+# Renumber windows when one is closed
+set -g renumber-windows on
+
+# Increase history limit
+set -g history-limit 50000
+
+# Faster key repetition
+set -s escape-time 0
+
+# Enable focus events
+set -g focus-events on
+
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Key Bindings
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+# Change prefix to Ctrl-a (more ergonomic than Ctrl-b)
+unbind C-b
+set -g prefix C-a
+bind C-a send-prefix
+
+# Reload config
+bind r source-file ~/.config/tmux/tmux.conf \; display "Config reloaded!"
+
+# Split panes using | and -
+bind | split-window -h -c "#{pane_current_path}"
+bind - split-window -v -c "#{pane_current_path}"
+unbind '"'
+unbind %
+
+# Navigate panes with vim keys
+bind h select-pane -L
+bind j select-pane -D
+bind k select-pane -U
+bind l select-pane -R
+
+# Resize panes with vim keys
+bind -r H resize-pane -L 5
+bind -r J resize-pane -D 5
+bind -r K resize-pane -U 5
+bind -r L resize-pane -R 5
+
+# New window in current path
+bind c new-window -c "#{pane_current_path}"
+
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Status Bar
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+# Status bar position
+set -g status-position bottom
+
+# Status bar style
+set -g status-style 'bg=#1e1e2e fg=#cdd6f4'
+
+# Status bar left
+set -g status-left-length 40
+set -g status-left '#[fg=#89b4fa,bold]  #S #[default]â”‚ '
+
+# Status bar right
+set -g status-right-length 100
+set -g status-right '#[fg=#a6adc8]#{?client_prefix,#[fg=#f9e2af]PREFIX ,}#[fg=#89dceb]%H:%M #[fg=#94e2d5]%Y-%m-%d '
+
+# Window status
+set -g window-status-format '#[fg=#6c7086] #I:#W '
+set -g window-status-current-format '#[fg=#f5c2e7,bold] #I:#W '
+
+# Pane borders
+set -g pane-border-style 'fg=#45475a'
+set -g pane-active-border-style 'fg=#89b4fa'
+
+# Message style
+set -g message-style 'bg=#313244 fg=#cdd6f4'
+
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# Copy Mode (Vi style)
+# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+setw -g mode-keys vi
+bind -T copy-mode-vi v send -X begin-selection
+bind -T copy-mode-vi y send -X copy-pipe-and-cancel 'xclip -in -selection clipboard'
